definitions: To hit, kick, or throw (a ball or other object) high into the air.
To store or place (something) in a loft or attic.
To build or convert (a space) into a loft apartment or living area.
examples: He managed to loft the ball over the defender's head.
They decided to loft their old furniture in the attic.
The developer plans to loft the old warehouse into luxury apartments.
